svad: This property verifies that the interrupt request signal irq is asserted when both the TSR[7] and TCR[7] bits are set to 1. The check is triggered at every positive edge of the clock signal clk whenever both TSR[7] and TCR[7] equal 1 simultaneously. When this condition occurs, the property expects the irq signal to be 1 at the same clock edge. The assertion is disabled and not checked when the reset signal rst is active.

# SVA Generation Chain-of-Thought

**Property:** p_irq_assignment
**Type:** Assertion

## Step 1: Interface & Clock Domain Analysis

* **Signals:**
    * Design Signals: `TCR`, `TSR`, `irq`

* **Clocks & Resets:**
    * Primary Clock: `clk` (posedge)
    * Reset Signal: `rst` (Active High)

* **Cross-Domain Check:** 
    * Single clock domain - no CDC concerns

## Step 2: Semantic Mapping (Primitives & Built-ins)

* **Boolean Conditions:**
    * Trigger condition: `(TSR[7] == 1 && TCR[7] == 1)`
    * Response condition: `(irq == 1)`

## Step 3: Sequence Construction (Bottom-Up)

* **Sequence A (Trigger/Antecedent):**
    * Description: The triggering condition that initiates property evaluation
    * Logic: `(TSR[7] == 1 && TCR[7] == 1)`

* **Sequence B (Response/Consequent):**
    * Description: The expected behavior when trigger occurs
    * Logic: `(irq == 1)`

## Step 4: Property Assembly

* **Implication Type:**
    * Overlapping (`|->`) - consequent evaluation starts in the same cycle as antecedent match

* **Disable Condition:**
    * `disable iff (rst)`
    * Property is disabled when reset `rst` is active high

* **Assertion Structure:**
    * `@(posedge clk) (TSR[7] == 1 && TCR[7] == 1) |-> (irq == 1)`

## Step 5: Final SVA Code

```systemverilog
property p_irq_assignment;
    @(posedge clk) disable iff (rst)
        (TSR[7] == 1 && TCR[7] == 1) |-> (irq == 1);
endproperty
assert_p_irq_assignment: assert property (p_irq_assignment) else $error("Assertion failed: irq signal is not asserted when both TSR[7] and TCR[7] are set to 1");
```

**Summary:**
Property `p_irq_assignment` uses overlapping implication synchronized to `clk`.
